questions.text: Which of the following fluoroquinolone has maximum Oral Bioavailability?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Levofloxacin Levofloxacin is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections in adults and children (;6 months age). It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and lungs (pneumonia). It cures the infection by stopping the further growth of the causative microorganisms.

Highyeild:

Levoisomer of ofloxacin Oral bioavailability is approximately 100% Excreted unchanged Used in CAP, TB (in MDR TB), Skin and soft tissue infections NOTE: Ofloxacin also has approximately 100% oral bioavailability

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections. It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and soft tissues and lungs (pneumonia). It prevents the bacterial cells from dividing and repairing, thereby killing them. Option: B. Gatifloxacin is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections. It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and soft tissues and lungs (pneumonia). It prevents the bacterial cells from dividing and repairing, thereby killing them. Option: D . Moxifloxacin is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections of the eye. It relieves the symptoms of the infection by stopping the further growth of the causative microorganisms.

questions.text: Ciprofloxacin/fluoroquinolones are contraindicated in children because of which of the following side effect?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

They cause arthropathy Fluoroquinolones are not recommended for use in infants and children. Patients up to age 18 have not been included in clinical trials because fluoroquinolones caused lameness in immature dogs due to permanent lesions of the cartilage of weight-bearing joints

Highyeild:

The side effect of ciprofloxacin Side Effects Cipro 1.Upset stomach 2. Vomiting 3.Diarrhea 4.Headache 5. Stomach pain

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B . They cause mental retardation is not a side effect of fluoroquinolone. Option: C . Agranulocytosis is not such an association with fluoroquinolone.

questions.text: A 46-year-old male with chronic uti has been prescribed the drug norfloxacin. The mechanism of development of resistance against this drug is by all of the following except :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Altered metabolic pathway Altered metabolic pathway is the correct option.

Highyeild:

Fluoroquinolones Broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against a variety of gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria They block bacterial DNA synthesis by inhibiting bacterial: Topoisomerase II (DNA gyrase): prevents the relaxation of positively supercoiled DNA that is required for normal transcription and replication Topoisomerase IV: interferes with separation of replicated chromosomal DNA into the respective daughter cells during cell division Originally developed because of their excellent activity against gram-negative aerobic bacteria; they had limited activity against gram-positive organisms Sulfonamides develop resistance by the following mechanisms: Produce increased amounts of PABA Their folate synthase enzyme has a low affinity for sulfonamides Adopt an alternative pathway in folate metabolism (option b)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Resistance to norfloxacin (fluoroquinolones) is due to chromosomal mutation producing a DNA gyrase or topoisomerase iv with reduced affinity for fqs (option c), or due to reduced permeability (option d)/increased efflux (option a) of these drugs across bacterial membranes.

questions.text: A 23-year-old female with tonsillitis came to ent opd. The doctor prescribed her the drug ofloxacin. The mechanism of action of this drug is by :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Inhibits DNA gyrase

Highyeild:

Mechanism of action Inhibition of DNA gyrase → prevents the relaxation of positively supercoiled DNA that is required for normal transcription and replication Inhibition of topoisomerase IV → interferes with separation of replicated chromosomal DNA into the respective daughter cells during cell division.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B . Inhibits cell wall synthesis: the drugs acting by this mechanism are: penicillin, cephalosporins, carbapenems, monobactams, vancomycin, cycloserine, and bacitracin. Option: C. Causes leakage from cell membranes: the drugs acting by this mechanism are: polymyxin, colistin, bacitracin, and amphotericin b. Option: D. Interfere with DNA function: rifampicin acts by this mechanism.

questions.text: A 36-year-old male has been prescribed fluoroquinolone for sinusitis. He developed photosensitivity after taking this drug. Which of the following drug would have been prescribed?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sparfloxacin Sparfloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic used in the treatment of bacterial infections. It has a controversial safety profile

Highyeild:

Sparfloxacin has frequently caused phototoxic reactions: recipients should be cautioned not to go out in the sun. Prolongation of qtc interval has been noted in 3% of recipients; fatal arrhythmias have occurred. It has been discontinued in many countries including the USA, but not yet in India.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Gemifloxacin . Side effects are skin rashes, diarrhoea, nausea, headache, dizziness & rise in serum amino-transferases. It can enhance the warfarin effect & carries the risk of additive q-t prolongation with other drugs. Option: C . Gatifloxacin causes deglycation. Hence it is not used nowadays and has been withdrawn. Option: D. Ciprofloxacin causes: Git: nausea, vomiting, bad taste, anorexia. Because gut anaerobes are not affected—diarrhoea is infrequent. Cns: dizziness, headache, restlessness, anxiety, insomnia, impairment of concentration & dexterity (caution while driving). Tremors & seizures are rare and occur only at high doses/ when predisposing factors are present. Skin/hypersensitivity: rash, pruritus, photosensitivity, urticaria, swelling of lips, etc. Tendonitis & tendon rupture: risk of tendon damage is higher in patients above 60 years of age & in those receiving corticosteroids. Due to reports of cartilage damage, fqs should be used cautiously in children. Ciprofloxacin & other fqs are contraindicated during pregnancy.

questions.text: A 52-year-old patient has been prescribed the drug gatifloxacin. This drug could have been prescribed for which of the following condition in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Conjunctivitis Conjunctivitis Inflammation of the transparent covering of the eye because of bacterial or viral infection or allergic reaction. The eye appears swollen, and red with an itching sensation.

Highyeild:

Gatifloxacin causes dysglycemia & is no longer available for systemic use due to toxicity concerns, but an ophthalmic preparation is licensed for the treatment of bacterial conjunctivitis.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B . Lrti, option C . Sinusitis & Option D . Uti - being systemic infections, need a systemic intake of the drug. Gatifloxacin is withdrawn for systemic use.
